definition: disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]

sentences.english: More than likely, Taelan would only revile me for what I've done.
sentences.chinese: 很有可能，泰兰只会为我所做的辱骂我。

sentences.english: He CNNs his old friends for not lending money to him.
sentences.chinese: 老朋友们因为不愿意借钱给他而遭到他无耻地辱骂。

sentences.english: President George Bush has had many insults hurled at him during his time in office.
sentences.chinese: 布什总统在其任内已经遭到过很多的辱骂了。

sentences.english: 16 at the taunts of those who reproach and revile me, because of the enemy, who is bent on revenge.
sentences.chinese: 都因那辱骂毁谤人的声音，又因仇敌和报仇人的缘故。

sentences.english: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God's high priest?
sentences.chinese: 站在旁边的人说，你辱骂神的大祭司吗。

sentences.english: Heather Ellis, who is an Africa American, says customers yelled racial slurs at her.
sentences.chinese: 她说，顾客向她喊叫了与种族有关的辱骂言语。

sentences.english: Whoever corrects a scoffer wins abuse; whoever rebukes the wicked gets hurt.
sentences.chinese: 指斥亵慢人的必受辱骂，责备恶人的必被玷污。

sentences.english: He felt he would demean himself if he replied to the scurrilous letter.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得如果他回复那封充满辱骂的信，会自贬身份。

sentences.english: France 'to criminalize shouting at your wife'.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫辱骂妻子将涉嫌违法。

sentences.english: It also contained obscenities and angry denunciations of "rich kids."
sentences.chinese: 内容仍是对“富家子弟”的愤怒指责和辱骂。

sentences.english: However, the Silver Shilling was abused as an imitation from that moment on.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，从那一刻起，银先令就被辱骂是仿造的。

sentences.english: He even vowed to take across people who slandered him so that they would accomplish Buddhahood before he did.
sentences.chinese: 甚至誓愿度一切诋毁辱骂他的人比自己更早成佛。

sentences.english: Don't let her insults bias you against your husband.
sentences.chinese: 别让她的辱骂使你对你丈夫抱有偏见。

sentences.english: Racial slurs, racial jokes, all having to do with being Asian.
sentences.chinese: 种族主义辱骂，种族笑话，都是跟亚裔有关的。

sentences.english: Few bands have taken as much abuse for what they are not as Coldplay.
sentences.chinese: 很少有乐队因为他们不像酷玩而受到那么多辱骂。

sentences.english: He often rasped insults to his classmates.

definition: to hurl abuse/to deride/to call sb names
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
